intro: Mosla japonica, commonly known as Japanese bugloss, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Mosla japonica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine.
